Hardy]] | leader_since1 = 1896 | party1 = {{Canadian party colour|ON|Liberal|name}} | leaders_seat1 = [[Brant South]] | last_election1 = 45 | seats1 = 51 | seat_change1 = +6 | popular_vote1 = | percentage1 = | swing1 = | image2 = [[Image:James Whitney.jpg|150x150px]] | colour2 = {{Canadian party colour|ON|Conservative|nohash}} | leader2 = [[James P. Whitney]] | leader_since2 = 1896 | party2 = {{Canadian party colour|ON|Conservative|name}} | leaders_seat2 = [[Dundas (electoral district)|Dundas]] | last_election2 = 23 | seats2 = 42 | seat_change2 = +19 | popular_vote2 = | percentage2 = | swing2 = | map_image = | map_size = | map_caption = | title = Premier | before_election = [[Arthur Sturgis Hardy|Arthur S. Hardy]] | before_party = {{Canadian party colour|ON|Liberal|name}} | after_election = [[Arthur Sturgis Hardy|Arthur S. Hardy]] | after_party = {{Canadian party colour|ON|Liberal|name}} }} The '''Ontario general election, 1898''' was the ninth [[general election]] held in the Province of [[Ontario]], [[Canada]]. It was held on March 1, 1898, to elect the 94 Members of the [[9th Legislative Assembly of Ontario]] ("MLAs"). The [[Ontario Liberal Party]], led by [[Arthur Sturgis Hardy|Arthur S. Hardy]], won an eighth term in office with a clear majority – the [[Patrons of Industry]] and the [[Protestant Protective Association]] held no sway in this legislature. The [[Ontario Progressive Conservative Party|Ontario Conservative Party]], led by Sir [[James P. Whitney]], formed the [[official opposition]]. ==Results== {| class="wikitable" |- !  !Party !Leader |align="center"|[[Ontario general election, 1894|1894]] |align="center"|'''Elected''' |align="center"|% change {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Liberal/row}} |[[Ontario Liberal Party|Liberal]] |[[Arthur Sturgis Hardy|Arthur S. Hardy]] |align="right"|45 |align="right"|'''51 ''' |align="right"|+13.3% {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Progressive Conservatives/row}} |[[Ontario Progressive Conservative Party|Conservative]] |[[James P. Whitney]] |align="right"|23 |align="right"|'''42''' |align="right"|+82.6% {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Independents/row}} |Conservative Independent |   |align="right"|* |align="right"|'''1''' |align="right"|* {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Liberal/row}} |[[Ontario Liberal Party|Liberal]]-[[Patrons of Industry|Patron]] |  |align="right"|12 |align="right"|* |align="right"|-100% {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Liberal/row}} |[[Ontario Liberal Party|Liberal]]-[[Protestant Protective Association|P.P.A.]] |  |align="right"|1 |align="right"|- |align="right"|-100% {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Progressive Conservatives/row}} |[[Ontario Progressive Conservative Party|Conservative]]–[[Protestant Protective Association|P.P.A.]] |  |align="right"|6 |align="right"|* |align="right"|-100% {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Progressive Conservatives/row}} |[[Ontario Progressive Conservative Party|Conservative]]-[[Patrons of Industry|Patron]] |  |align="right"|1 |align="right"|- |align="right"|-100% {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Independents/row}} |[[Patrons of Industry]] |  |align="right"|3 |align="right"|- |align="right"|-100% {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Independents/row}} |[[Protestant Protective Association|Protestant Protective]] |  |align="right"|2 |align="right"|- |align="right"|-100% {{Canadian_politics/party_colours/Independents/row}} |Independent |   |align="right"|1 |align="right"|- |align="right"|-100% |- | colspan="3"|'''Total Seats''' |align="right"|'''94''' |align="right"|'''94''' |align="right"|''' -''' |} '''Note:''' <nowiki>*</nowiki> Party did not nominate candidates in the previous election. ==See also== *[[Politics of Ontario]] *[[List of political parties in Canada#Ontario|List of Ontario political parties]] *[[Premier of Ontario]] *[[Leader of the Opposition (Ontario)]] {{Ontario elections}} [[Category:General elections in Ontario]] [[Category:1898 elections in Canada]] {{canada-election-stub}}
